books.title: Richard II
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Richard II’s wasteful spending habits drive his supporters to revolt.

books.title: The Purple Land
books.author: W. H. Hudson
books.summary: An Englishman becomes embroiled in adventure, politics, and romance in 19th-century Uruguay.

books.title: Twenty Years at Hull House
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams’ autobiographical account of the founding and operation of Hull House, one of America’s most famous settlement homes.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Five Children and It
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children encounter an ancient magical creature who grants them wishes—all of which go comically wrong.

books.title: Misalliance
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: On a pleasant summer afternoon, a sudden plane crash followed by a would-be assassin interrupt a family’s conversations about marriage.

books.title: Henry IV, Part II
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The rebel forces plan another assault against King Henry’s forces after losing at the Battle of Shrewsbury.

books.title: Lud-in-the-Mist
books.author: Hope Mirrlees
books.summary: After more than two hundred years of stability, a sudden surge in contraband fairy fruit threatens the peace and mental heath of citizens in the borderland town of Lud-in-the-Mist.

books.title: Barchester Towers
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.summary: The affections of a young widow are at play while rival clerical factions contend for control over church matters in the cathedral city of Barchester.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.

books.title: Murder in the Maze
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: Twin brothers are found murdered in a maze, and the local Chief Constable must solve the crime.

books.title: The Practice and Theory of Bolshevism
books.author: Bertrand Russell
books.summary: Bertrand Russell travels to post-revolutionary Russia to see if Bolshevism achieves its communist aspirations.

books.title: Beyond Good and Evil
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: Nietzsche’s philosophical treatise on the ambiguity of traditional morality.

books.title: The Kalevala
books.author: Elias Lönnrot
books.summary: The Finnish national epic poem recounting the creation of the Earth and the adventures of its mythical heroes.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: Omega
books.author: Camille Flammarion
books.summary: A comet threatens to collide with the Earth, perhaps bringing about the end of the world.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: A collection of Selma Lagerlöf’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Pursuit of God
books.author: A. W. Tozer
books.summary: A. W. Tozer’s classic work on Christian living, containing practical advice for those who wish to know God, not simply know about Him.

books.title: The Giant Raft
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: An ex-slave trader with an encrypted note schemes about its meaning, while a man with a secret past travels with his family down the Amazon in a giant raft to attend his daughter’s wedding.
